To apply gain with variation, you can modify the code in the startBufferedWrite method. After reading the audio data from the AudioRecord, you can apply the gain to each sample before writing it to the output stream.

Here's the modified code:

private void startBufferedWrite(final File file) {
    new Thread(new Runnable() {
        @Override
        public void run() {
            DataOutputStream output = null;
            try {
                output = new DataOutputStream(new BufferedOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(file)));
                while (mIsRecording) {
                    double sum = 0;
                    int readSize = mRecorder.read(mBuffer, 0, mBuffer.length);
                    for (int i = 0; i < readSize; i++) {
                        // Apply gain with variation
                        short sample = mBuffer[i];
                        sample *= iGain;
                        mBuffer[i] = sample;

                        output.writeShort(mBuffer[i]);
                        sum += mBuffer[i] * mBuffer[i];
                    }
                    if (readSize > 0) {
                        final double amplitude = sum / readSize;
                        mProgressBar.setProgress((int) Math.sqrt(amplitude));
                    }
                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                Toast.makeText(Mediarec.this, e.getMessage(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
            } finally {
                mProgressBar.setProgress(0);
                if (output != null) {
                    try {
                        output.flush();
                    } catch (IOException e) {
                        Toast.makeText(Mediarec.this, e.getMessage(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT)
                                .show();
                    } finally {
                        try {
                            output.close();
                        } catch (IOException e) {
                            Toast.makeText(Mediarec.this, e.getMessage(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT)
                                    .show();
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }).start();
}

In this code, the gain is applied to each sample in the mBuffer array before writing it to the output stream. The gain value is stored in the iGain variable, which can be adjusted based on your requirements.

Note: Make sure to update the iGain value based on your desired gain level.
